basics.name: Victor Tolbert
basics.label: Software Engineer
basics.summary: I'm a full-stack software engineer with 15+ years of experience in web development, design engineering, and product design. Passionate about creating innovative solutions that solve real-world problems.

work.name: Hancock Claims Consultants
work.summary: Provided user interface engineering subject matter expertise and technical leadership for the development of a new web-based claims management system and property inspection mobile-friendly web applications
highlights: Lead developer responsible for implementing payment features using the Authorize.net API, converting manual payment processes to automated processes
Converted .NET legacy application to a modern MPA using ASP.NET Core MVC, Vue.js, TypeScript and TailwindCSS
Gained knowledge of the Microsoft Azure cloud platform and services including Azure DevOps, Azure SQL, Azure App Services, Azure Functions, Azure Storage,  and Azure Application Insights
Tech Stack: ASP.NET Core MVC, Vue.js, TypeScript, TailwindCSS, Bootstrap, jQuery, AJAX, SQL Server, Git, Github, Azure DevOps

work.name: Booster Enterprises
work.summary: Designed, developed, and implemented new features and functionalities for core business application used by parents, sponsors, clients, and internal teams
highlights: Participated in the design and development process from definition to deployment
Worked closely with the design team to ensure consistent UI/UX implementations
Collaborated with the agile development team and engaged in team meetings
Assisted team in managing the overall codebase and infrastructure to minimize downtime
Implemented best practices and helped to create a scalable innovative application
Tech Stack: HTML5, CSS (TailwindCSS, Bulma, Bootstrap), JavaScript, Vue.js, CodeIgniter, Laravel, jQuery, AJAX

work.name: Turner Sports, PGA.com
work.summary: Developed dynamic and data-driven solutions for consumer facing web and digital platforms for PGA.COM, Ryder Cup, PGA Championship and events platform. Actively participated in project design and direction with new tools and features.
highlights: Hands-on front-end development for custom Drupal based events/CMS platform and back-end

Worked cross-functionally with the development team and functional teams throughout full SDLC from requirements, coding, testing, peer reviews, documentation, deployment and post-launch support and improvement
Spearheaded the standardization of front-end development processes and best practices
Troubleshot performance and cross-browser implementation issues for desktop and mobile platforms
Tech Stack: Git, Github, CircleCI, JIRA, Visual Studio Code, PHP, Drupal, JavaScript (Vue.js, React, jQuery), CSS (Sass), Gulp

work.name: Videa, A Cox Media Group Company
work.summary: Designed and developed a web-based interactive product demo using Node.js and Vue.js
highlights: Conceptualized and prototyped new features for core product utilizing Vue.js, Vue Router and Vuex

Recognized company-wide for individual effort and contribution of a product demo (Vue.js, Nuxt.js) used as a stand-in for the real product at the National Association of Broadcasters (NAB) trade conference
Created Open Source TVB XML Proposal Viewer utilizing PHP/MySQL and the Laravel Framework
Served as the sole liaison between visual design, on-site and off-shore engineering teams
Tech Stack: Microsoft .Net MVC, TFS, Git, Visual Studio, Azure, AWS, PHP, Wordpress, Laravel, JavaScript (AngularJS, Vue.js, React), Kendo UI

work.name: AT&T Mobility
highlights: Provided user interface development for a project to integrate the AT&T Locker, Messages and Contacts cloud applications into one unified consumer application suite
Collaborator and contributor to custom in-house Sass/CSS bootstrapping framework to consistently implement AT&T’s CDLS 2.0 branded styles and flexible components
Develop middleware services using Java/Groovy based Camel framework
Tech Stack: Java, JSP, Apache CAML, JavaScript (AngularJS), CSS/Sass

work.name: WebMD.com
highlights: Team lead for key revenue generating products and initiatives
Hand-coded and documented modular website components using object-oriented native JavaScript and jQuery
Converted a Flash-based widget for iPhone/iPad compatibility using HTML5, CSS3 animations and JavaScript
Mentored and on-boarded new team members
Received a “Star” award for outstanding teamwork
JavaScript (jQuery), CSS3 (Sass/Compass), HTML5, XSL/XSLT, Documentum, WordPress, Endeca WebStudio, Git, Github Enterprise

work.name: AutoTrader.com
highlights: Rapidly prototyped the vehicle compare tool user interface for usability testing
Presented and demo’d prototype to an audience including the CEO, CFO and CIO
Received a company-wide monthly “Top Techie” award multiple times
HTML, CSS, JavaScript (Prototype/Scriptaculous), JAVA (JSP, JSTL, JSF), CVS, Subversion, Rhythmyx

education.area: Domain Modeling for JavaScript Apps with Mirage JS
Mastering JavaScript and Advanced JavaScript Best Practices

references.name: Phil Greco
references.reference:
I have had the opportunity to work with Victor at three different companies, AutoTrader, WebMD and most recently Videa.

Victor is a passionate user interface engineer / architect who is skilled at determining good UI development approaches, best practices and then implementing them.   For example, at Videa he successfully defined our interface standards, implemented an online code base style guide, constructed our interfaces, and worked well with the UX team to create great user interactions.   Plus, without being asked he created a complete standalone demo application to ensure the company would have something functional to show at two NAB conferences.  This proactive approach was outstanding and helped the company close a few deals.

Besides being talented UI professional, Victor is also a great person to work with.  Victor is very personable, funny, and has a positive team based approach to working.  

I look forward to hiring and working with him again.

references.name: Dawson Blackhouse
references.reference: Victor is a meticulous developer who delivers his craft with company goals in mind.

references.name: Frankie Loscavio
references.reference: Victor was great to work with at AT&T. I find myself learning something new every very time I speak to Victor. Whether it's a front-end development solution or a new design approach Victor always showed me that there is something amazing to learn all the time. I found Victor's attitude refreshing and inspiring, while motivating me and others to be the same. I feel he is an exceptionally skilled developer / designer as well as a leader and would really like to work with him again some day. I feel that his passion for learning and applying that knowledge to the front-end side of development / design is inspirational and think you'll be very fortunate to have him on your team.  I hope I get to work with Victor again some day soon.

references.name: George Kovats
references.reference: Victor has always demonstrated a great attitude toward new work, and helped us always plow through the ebbs and flows of operational projects that hit our team, often holding the lion's share of asignments. He's passionate about learning new technology especially regarding front-end web trends, and was one of our departments first promoters of GitHub and SASS. It was always a pleasure working with Victor, and I believe he's a strong asset as a front end developer for any web team.

references.name: Ed Jenkins
references.reference: When I need to delegate a task, I need someone who can do it, do it right, and do it fast.  Victor is the one I trust.

references.name: Patrick Fitzgerald
references.reference: Victor has a wide breadth of knowledge in web design and usability. He is extremely quick in mastering new tools and technologies, easily jumping between Windows, Mac, and Linux environments. It is a pleasure to work with him.
